definition: lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out
chaste tree or berry (Vitex agnus-castus)/alternative name for the Zhou Dynasty state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
thorns

sentences.english: He went to strike at the hedge, but where his sword met the thorns, great roses bloomed instead.
sentences.chinese: 他开始披荆斩棘，但是他宝剑所到之处都开出了蔷薇。

sentences.english: Enterprise clarifies, cuts through, and captures, the essence of the evolutionary spirit.
sentences.chinese: 进取心可以厘清一切，披荆斩棘直捣演化的精髓。

sentences.english: You know a heart of gold won't take you all the way.
sentences.chinese: 你要知道一颗善良的心不会一直庇佑为你披荆斩棘。

sentences.english: But you possess the inner courage to see you through.
sentences.chinese: 你拥有披荆斩棘的勇气。

sentences.english: We can march through only because you are leading the way ahead.
sentences.chinese: 有你在前面的披荆斩棘，才有后面众驴友的阔步前进。

sentences.english: The explorers had to beat a path through the dense bushes.
sentences.chinese: 探险家们得披荆斩棘，在茂密的灌木丛林中辟路前进。

sentences.english: Reincarnation, I dedicated to the pursuit, clearing a path through.
sentences.chinese: 轮回里，我执着地追寻，一路披荆斩棘。

definition: see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
untold dangers and difficulties (idiom)
to advance bravely
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to advance courageously (idiom)/to press forward
lit. a path covered in brambles/a course of action beset by difficulties (idiom)
lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
dangerous and difficult (path)
long journey/trek/course of an expedition
highway/level road
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to struggle/to wrestle
(literary) to go forward
difficult and dangerous/hardships and perils
